traits.Stability: An amaru gets a +4 racial bonus to CMD when resisting bull rush or trip attempts.
traits.Stalker: Perception and stealth are always considered class skills for an amaru.
traits.Pyromaniac: An amaru is treated as 1 level higher when casting spells with the fire descriptor or that deal fire damage. In addition, Amarus with a charisma score of 11 or higher gain dancing lights, flare, prestidigitaion, and produce flame, as spell-like abilities, usable once per day.
traits.Hypnotic Gaze: Amarus can cast hypnotism once a day, for 1 round.
traits.Darkvision: An amaru can see 60 feet in total darkness.
traits.Prehensile Tail: Amarus can use their tail to carry objects. They cannot wield weapons with their tails, but can retrieve small, stored objects carried on them as a swift action.

Slapping Tail.description: An amaru can use their tail to make a secondary natural attack that deals 1d8 + their strength modifier bludgeoning damage.

traits.Eagle Eyes: Avaar gain a +2 racial bonus on Perception checks and treat Perception as  class skill.
traits.Envoy: Avaar with an Intelligence score of 11 or higher gain comprehend languages, detect magic, detect poison, and read magic as spell-like abilities that can be used once a day.
traits.Flight: Avaar have a fly speed of 50 feet with average maneuverability.

Tropical Plumage.description: Some avaar from equitorial islands have more vibrant plumage and can use it to cast hypnotism once per day as a spell-like ability.

Owl Heritage.description: Some avaar have specialized into nocturnalism, and can see in the dark (darkvision), up to 120 feet.

traits.Cat's Luck: Once per day, before making a Reflex saving throw, a caeth can roll twice and take the better result.
traits.Curiosity: Caeth gain a +4 racial bonus on Diplomacy checks and treat Knowledge (history and local) as class skills. If either is already a class skill, they get a +2 racial bonus instead.
traits.Stalker: Perception and Stealth are always class skills for Caeth.
traits.Jumper: Caeth are always considered to have a running start when making an Acrobatics check to jump.
traits.Claws: Caeth have strong claws that they can use as a primary natural attacks. They can make 2 attacks per turn that deal 1d4 + their strength modifier slashing damage.
traits.Low-Light Vision: Caeth can see in color up to 60 feet away in dim light.

Climber.description: Some Caeth possess a climb speed of 20 feet and gain a +8 racial bonus on climb checks from having a climb speed.

traits.Healthy: Geiter gain a +4 racial bonus on Fortitude saves against disease and poison, including magical diseases.
traits.Mountain-Born: Geiter gain a +2 racial bonus on Acrobatics checks made to cross narrow ledges.
traits.Craftsman: Geiter gain a +2 racial bonus on Craft and Profession checks when using metal or stone.
traits.Stonecunning: Geiter gain a +2 racial bonus on Perception checks to notice unusual stonework, such as traps and hidden doors. They recieve a check to notice such features whenever they pass within 10 feet, whether or not they are actively looking.
traits.Mountaineer: Geiter are immune to altitude sickness and do not lose their Dexterity bonus to AC when making Climb or Acrobatics checks to cross narrow or slippery surfaces.
traits.Rock Stepper: Geiter can skillfully navigate rocky terrain, ignoring difficult terrain caused by rubble, broken ground, or steep stairs.
traits.Hatred: Geiter gain a +1 racial bonus on attack rolls made against Plant creatures.
traits.Weapon Familiarity: Geiter are always proficient with Warhammers and Dwarven weapons.
traits.Darkvision: Geiter can see 60 feet in total darkness, this vision is black and white.

Frenzy.description: Geiter who are trained for battle from birth can go into a frenzy upon taking damage. This frenzy lasts for 1 minute (10 rounds) and adds a +2 racial bonus to Constitution and Strength, but a -2 to AC.

traits.Shell: Kame gain a +3 natural armor bonus to AC.
traits.Historian: Kame gain a +2 racial bonus on Knowledge (History) checks and treat it as a class skill.
traits.Skill Training: Kame treat Knowledge (Geography) and Knowledge (Nature) as class skills.
traits.Swim: Kame have a swim speed of 30 feet and get a +8 racial bonus on swim checks from the swim seed.
traits.Amphibious: Kame can breath both air and water.

Water Sense.description: Ryui-Kame can sense vibrations in water, granting them blindsense for 30 feet against creatures that are touching the same body of water.

traits.Animal Friend: Zikari always treat Handle Animal and Ride as class skills.
traits.Animal Minded: Zikari get a +2 racial bonus on Handle Animal checks.
traits.Natural Rider: Zikari get a +2 racial bonus on Ride checks.
traits.Change Shape: All zikaru have an animal form they can change into. A zikaru can shift to and from this form as a move action that does not provoke AoO. This ability functions as Beast Shape II, with no components or duration, but the zikaru reverts back to their humanoid form when unconcious or dead.
traits.Gatecrasher: Zikari gain a +2 racial bonus on Strength checks to break objects and a +2 racial bonus on combat maneuver checks to sunder.

Quick Reflexes.description: Some zikari are more agile than they are brutish, they recieve Improved Initiative as a bonus feat.

traits.Plagueborn: Tembo gain a +2 racial bonus on saving throws against disease, ingested poisons, and becoming nauseated or sickened.
traits.Sprinter: Tembo gain a +10 foot racial bonus to their speed when charging, running, or withdrawing (but not double moving).
traits.Tusks: Tembo can use their tusks as a primary natural attack. They can make one gore attack per round that deals 1d8 + half their Strength modifier piercing damage.
traits.Stampede: A tembo deals 2d8 + one and a half times thier Strength modifier when using their tusks as part of a charge.

traits.Armor: Kobolds' naturally scaly skin grants them a +1 natural armor bonus.
traits.Crafty: Kobolds gain a +2 racial bonus on Craft (trapmaking), Perception, and Profession (miner) checks. Craft (trapmaking) and Stealth are always class skills for a kobold.
traits.Darkvision: Kobolds can see perfectly in the dark up to 60 feet.
traits.Light Sensitivity: Kobolds lives in darkness have caused them to suffer from light sensitivity.

Day Raider.description: You’re one of the few kobolds born with a greater tolerance for sunlight. You don’t have light sensitivity, and you have low-light vision instead of darkvision.

Dragonmaw.description: Your draconic heritage grants you a bite attack that deals 1d4 piercing damage. Once per day, you can deal 1d6 points of additional energy damage with your bite attack dependant on your color.

traits.Armor: Kobolds' naturally scaly skin grants them a +1 natural armor bonus.

DayRaider.description: You’re one of the few kobolds born with a greater tolerance for sunlight. You don’t have light sensitivity, and you have low-light vision instead of darkvision.
